page.title: 06CLUBS IN GREAT EASTON
page.content: All the clubs in Great Easton are held in the village hall. They are "Old Time Dancing",on Tuesdays,run by Mr Copping.On Wednesdays it is"Carpet Bowls",from 8.00pm-10.00pm,any one can join.They have refreshments for league games. They use a narrow carpet 9.90m. About 20 people belong. Bert Pickford runs it.They use 3 inch and 2.25 inch bowls.On Thursdays there is a"Youth Club" run by Bob Putt, Pat Thorburn and Mr.Howie for 14-21 year olds.They play games and can buy sweets and drinks.It is 25 pence to get in and Â£1 for a year's membership. They also arrange outings. On Fridays there is a "Judo Club" from 7.00-8.00pm,run by Peter Thake. They start training at 7 years old.
